item.title: Afghanistan crisis: Taliban kill civilians in resistance stronghold
item.description: The militants target civilians in Panjshir, the BBC finds, despite promises of restraint.

item.title: China's coronavirus-fuelled surfing boom
item.description: Covid travel restrictions that have limited foreign travel have led to a boom in surfing in China.

item.title: Afghan women hit back at Taliban with #DoNotTouchMyClothes campaign
item.description: Afghan women show off their traditional dress as black burqas spread under the Taliban.

item.title: Afghanistan: More than $1bn pledged for Afghanistan
item.description: Countries vow to step up support as people in Afghanistan face "perhaps their most perilous hour".

item.title: Twenty years after 9/11, will al-Qaeda rise again?
item.description: Where is al-Qaeda 20 years after the 9/11 attacks - and could it re-emerge as a terror threat?

item.title: North Korea tests new long-range cruise missile
item.description: It suggests the country is developing new weapons despite food shortages and an economic crisis.

item.title: Megapod of feeding humpback whales 'so special'
item.description: A megapod of over 100 humpback whales has been filmed feeding off Australia's New South Wales coast.

item.title: Afghanistan: Taliban announce new rules for female students
item.description: Students will be segregated by gender and have to observe a dress code.

item.title: Raducanu: US Open champion celebrated in China for her heritage
item.description: Many in China have been quick to point out the 18-year-old's half-Chinese heritage.

item.title: World War Two: The forgotten Indian soldiers of Dunkirk
item.description: Some 300 Indian soldiers were evacuated from the coast of France during a pivotal moment in World War Two.

item.title: Why North Korea keeps launching missiles
item.description: North Korea keeps testing missiles despite international condemnation. Why does Pyongyang persist?

item.title: India appointed three top women judges. Is it too early to celebrate?
item.description: Appointment of three women to India's Supreme Court is being hailed as a "historic moment".

item.title: Why is there a food emergency in Sri Lanka?
item.description: With a weak economy and worsening Covid situation, a food emergency has been declared in the country.

item.title: Bhupendra Patel: Why Gujarat chief ministers can't finish their term
item.description: India's ruling BJP party replaced the last two chief ministers just months ahead of state elections.
